gurmukhi: qUix ksy kt cwNp Dry kr kop khI idj rwm Aho ]
transliteration: Toon(i) Kase Kat Chaanp Ddare Kar Kop Kahidih Raam Aho||
translation: Wearnig his bow and quiver, the Brahmin Parshuram in great rage said to Ram :

gurmukhi: gH qoh srwsn sMkr ko sIA jwq hry qum kaun kho ]
transliteration: Grah Tor Saraasan Sankar Ko Seea Jaat Dare Toum Kaoun Kaho||
translation: “O the breaker of the bow of Shiva and the conqueror of Sita, who ate you?

gurmukhi: ibn swc khy nyhI pRwn bcy ijn kMT kuTwr kI Dwr sho ]
transliteration: Bin Saach Kahe Nahipraan Bache Jin Kanth Kouthaar Kidhaar Saho||
translation: “Tell me the truth otherwise you will not he able to save yourself and you will have to bear the blow of the sharp edge of my axe on your neck.

gurmukhi: Gr jwhu cly qj rwm rxM ijn jUJ mro pl TwF rho ]147]
transliteration: Ghar Jaahu Chale Taj Raam Ranan Jin Joojh Daro Pal Thaadh Raho||147||
translation: “It will be appropriate, if you leave the war-arena and run away to your home, otherwise if you stay here for another instant, you will have to die.”147.

gurmukhi: jwnq ho Aivlok muJY hiT eyk blI nhI TwF rhYNgy ]
transliteration: Jaanat Ho Avilok Mujhai Hath(i) Ek Balinahithaadh Rahainge||
translation: “You know that no mighty warrior can stay here firmly on seeing me;

gurmukhi: qwiq ghXo ijn ko qiRx dwNqn qyn khw rx Awj ghYNgy ]
transliteration: Taat(i) Gadyo Jin Ke Trin Daantan Ten Kahaa Ran Aaj Gadainge||
translation: “Those whose fathers and grandfathers held the blades of grass within their teeth on seeing me (i.e. they accepted defeat) what type of war will they wage with me now?

gurmukhi: bMb bjy rx KMf gfy gih hwQ hiQAwr khUM aumhYNgy ]
transliteration: Banb Bade Ran Khanbh Gade Gad(i) Haath Hathiaar Kahoon Oumhainge||
translation: “Even if there is waged a terrible war how can they be bold enough now to march forward for war by taking hold of their weapons again?

gurmukhi: BUm Akws pqwl durYby kau rwm kho khwN Twm lhYNgy ]148]
transliteration: Bhoom Akaas Pataal Duraibe Kau Raam Kaho Kahaan Thaam Lahainge||148||
translation: “Then tell me, O Ram, where will you find a place one earth, sky or netherworld to hide yourself?”148.

gurmukhi: XO jb bYn suny Air ky qb sRI rGubIr blI blkwny ]
transliteration: Yau Jab Bain Sure Ar(i) Ke Tab Sriraghoubeer Balibalkaane||
translation: Hearing these words of the enemy (Parashuram), Ram looked like a mighty hero.

gurmukhi: swq smuMdRn lO grvy igr BUm Akws doaU Qhrwny ]
transliteration: Saat Samoonddran Lau Gadve Gir Bhoom Akaas Dooo Thahraane||
translation: Visualising the serene posture of Ram, exhibiting the serenity of seven seas, the mountains, Sky and the whole world trembled.

gurmukhi: j`C BujMg idsw ibidswn ky dwnv dyv duhUM fr mwny ]
transliteration: Jachchh Bhujand Disaa Bidisaan Ke Daanav Dev Duhoon Dar Maane||
translation: The Yakshas, Nagas, gods gods demons of all the four directions were frightened.
